intro: Psittacanthus piurensis, commonly known as the Piura spurge, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically Peru. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
